name: Otis Elevator Company
address: Otis Elevator Company, 17-3771 N Fraser Way, Burnaby, BC V5J 5G5

featured_reviews.review_id: Sort of surprised reading through these comments since I have had good experiences. I am a building manager in the Okanagan looking after a seven story building with two elevators. They work great and rarely have any issues. The Otis representative who looks after this region, Brad is good. He is always quick to respond and helpful. Very satisfied

featured_reviews.review_id:
Our company has been dealing with Otis for years, in the past two years the Otis  has fallen to the worst elevator company in the province. They never make it to site on their scheduled time, then they apologize and try to replace that with an option for overtime. The problem is they do this every time which shows their tactics Such a scam.
TK elevator is way better!

featured_reviews.review_id: Impossible to get any Otis worker on site to check their faulty workmanship. What a joke
featured_reviews.review_text: Impossible to get any Otis worker on site to check their faulty workmanship. What a joke

featured_reviews.review_id: If your a developer and looking for elevators then do not look here they are the worst elevators imaginable. first it broke down for 4 months while they "waited on a part" then was up for a month and broke down for a week that was fixed and fast forward 2 months it broke down this week for 3 days they came out and fix it and now 2 days later it's now broken again......I don't know how this is possible in a 6 year old building. They never show up to fix it when they say there going too and the people they do send don't look or act professional in and way. and reading all the past reviews in not sure how this company is still in business. SO BUYERS BEWARE DO NOT BUY FROM OTIS!!!! I've lived in apartments for over 10 years and never had any issues until I moved here and now in a year 4 times it's been broken in one building and even more if u include the other buildings in the complex.

featured_reviews.review_id: Stuck in elevator and they never did anything. Our building manager took over and made she we were safe not Otis. Call the number in the elevator and still nothing done by them. Good things have a access to very good lawyers. Don't worry the records from our condo and fire department will be enough. Word of advice to people, pick any other company besides Otis as they can't do worse than Otis. This post was done as I'm stuck in the elevator waiting for help.

featured_reviews.review_id:
I am in an 8-story apartment building in the West End of Vancouver.  We have a single elevator, which has been out of service since about July 24.  (That is, we have had no elevator for over a month now.)  Our building manager has been unable to get any news from Otis.  Initially, we were told it would take about a week to fix it.  Then another week.  Then Otis said they would come on Monday, and simply didn't show up for a week.  They evidently don't work on Saturdays, Sundays, or holidays.

here are elderly people in the building who are missing their doctor's appointments, and who don't like being unable to go out for over a month.  I have phoned Otis Canada a few times, but have never been able to get any information.  My wife has cancelled 8 physiotherapy appointments. (so far!)  Now the long weekend is coming up (Labour Day), people would like to move out.

One person wanted to move out 2 weeks ago.  He can't, because there's no elevator.  I find it extremely odd that Otis will not work for double or triple overtime or whatever.  I have sent the main office (not the Vancouver office) 3 emails, which they cannot be bothered to acknowledge, it seems; there is not even an automated reply.  I phoned the Vancouver office just now - put on hold, and then transferred to a different number, which didn't answer.  I phoned the Vancouver office again, and there was no answer.  We have had no information at all from Otis for about 2 weeks now.

It's incredible, really - there are about 60 apartments in this building, and no one knows when the elevator will be repaired, or even if it will be repaired ever.

featured_reviews.review_id: Absolutely Horrible company, they held our strata for ransom when they lost the contract to replace our elevators because they were 1M dollars higher priced and literally shut down our tower. sick people could not get ambulances to care for them and the firemen had to go up 38 stores to try and get to them. Clearly the almighty dollar is the only thing that drives this company. Their stuff is proprietary and they wont let anyone else service the elevator programming, give me a break. Welcome to the 21st century Otis ownership, Too Big, Too Fat, old guys in leadership not aware of how this could play for them online we have a voice!!! I hear Richmond elevator is eating them alive with customer service and fair pricing. Merry Christmas to the ownership. Start thinking about being good stewards to your customers because client experience is real now and will hurt your business for years to come. Governors Tower and Villas in Yale town

featured_reviews.review_id: Do they know our elevator (the only one) has been out of service since last October and the "manufactured" part will be here in March? Langley BC.... Good work Otis.
